meanings.definition: To ask persistently or urgently for something
meanings.sent1: The child importunes his mother for a toy at the store.
meanings.sent2: She importunes her boss for a raise every week.
meanings.sent3: The cat importunes its owner for treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain importunes the farmers, delaying their harvest.
meanings.sent5: The student importunes the teacher for extra credit to improve their grade.

meanings.definition: To make repeated requests or demands
meanings.sent1: He importunes his friends to join him for a movie night.
meanings.sent2: The charity importunes the community for donations every year.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock importunes him to wake up early every morning.
meanings.sent4: The wind importunes the trees, causing them to sway constantly.
meanings.sent5: The customer importunes the store clerk for assistance with a smile.

meanings.definition: To trouble or annoy with requests or demands
meanings.sent1: The persistent salesperson importunes customers to buy products they don't need.
meanings.sent2: The telemarketer importunes people during dinner time.
meanings.sent3: The bird importunes the cat by chirping loudly outside its window.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito importunes the camper, keeping them awake.
meanings.sent5: The neighbor importunes others with loud music late at night.
